thread.title: HIGHLIGHTS-Euro zone finance minister comments on Greece
thread.title_full: HIGHLIGHTS-Euro zone finance minister comments on Greece | Reuters

author: Reuters
title: HIGHLIGHTS-Euro zone finance minister comments on Greece
text:
BRUSSELS, July 11 Greek Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras won backing from lawmakers on Saturday for painful reforms but it remained unclear whether it would be enough to secure a bailout from German and other euro zone ministers meeting in Brussels.
The following are comments from the euro zone finance minister and others attending the Eurogroup meeting:
IMF DIRECTOR GENERAL CHRISTINE LAGARDE
"I think we are here to make a lot more progress."
EUROPEAN ECONOMIC AFFAIRS COMMISSIONER PIERRE MOSCOVICI
"Since the start, the European Commission had the objective, that of the integrity of the euro. It was to keep a reformed Greece in the euro zone."
"I note that the Greek government has made significant gestures."
"We (the creditors) have said the Greek reform programme could constitute a basis for a new programme."
"Our general sentiment is that there need to be reforms, solid reforms, reforms appropriate to the Greek authorities and reforms that are implemented as soon as possible."
(Reporting by Robert-Jan Bartunek, Philip Blenkinsop , Marine Hass, Alastair Macdonald , Alexander Saeedy, Foo Yun Chee , Tom Koerkemeier, Miranda Alexander-Webber)
